column2: FACTBOX-Boeing contract with machinists - details of agreement NEW YORK Boeing Co's machinist workers in the Pacific Northwest narrowly agreed on Friday to an eight-year contract extension that begins after the current contract expires in 2016. The new agreement guarantees them work on Boeing's newest jetliner
column4: in exchange for changes in their pay and benefits. ~Machinists vote helps Boeing avoid hiring crunch NEW YORK In clinching a deal with its machinist workers on Friday that will keep jetliner manufacturing in the Pacific Northwest
column5: Boeing Co  may not only have secured industrial peace until 2024 and brought its pension costs under control - it has also avoided facing a recruitment nightmare. ~UPDATE 2-Boeing machinists approve contract securing 777X jet SEATTLE/NEW YORK
column6: Jan 3 Boeing's machinists on Friday narrowly approved a crucial labor contract that secured thousands of jobs and billions of dollars of economic activity for Washington state but will cost workers their pensions. ~Boeing machinists approve contract tied to 777X with 51 pct vote SEATTLE
column7: Jan 3 Boeing Co machinists approved on Friday a contract offer that ensured the company's latest jetliner is built in Washington state
column8: ending the threat of sending thousands of jobs and billions of dollars of economic activity to other locations. ~

column2: NY Fed moves to dismiss suit brought by former Goldman examiner NEW YORK
column3: Jan 3 The New York Federal Reserve Bank filed a motion on Friday to dismiss a lawsuit brought by a former employee who claimed she was fired after refusing to alter a critical examination of Goldman Sachs Group Inc. ~
